Caption: Fig. 1. Analysis pipeline of the case study discussed in Section 5.1.2. (A), (B), and (C) show different states of the intra-stroke matrices of Stroke 3, and the inter-stroke matrix of the stroke placement between Strokes 2 and 3. (A) shows the initial state. (B) shows the state change from (A) when a grid cell (A-3) of the inter-stroke matrix was selected. (C) shows the state change from (B) when the expert clicked on a grid cell (B-1) of the intra-stroke matrix representing the correlation of stroke techniques and stroke placements of Stroke 3. (D) shows the serve tactics in the end phases of rallies. The top five rows show the tactics of Player 1, while the remaining rows represent the tactics of Player 2. (E) shows the aggregated relationships of strokes after Stroke 5.
Fig. 2. Illustration of important concepts of table tennis: (A) four stroke positions, (B) backhand and forehand area, (C) backhand and forehand, and (D) nine stroke placements.

Fig. 3. Interface of iTTVis with a unified color encoding (A-1). The interface comprises five well-coordinated views: the match view (including a tailored step chart (B-1), a point outcome bar (B-2), and a selection panel (B-3)), the stroke view (collapsed and minimized in (C)), the stat view (D), the tactic view (E), and the history view (F).
Fig. 4. The stroke view displays a series of tables with detailed infor- mation of each stroke. The stroke technique, position, and effect are displayed when hovering on the ball (A).

Fig. 6. (A) shows a tactic in which the attributes of each stroke are visually encoded by three glyphs. For instance, the attributes of the first stroke of the tactic are represented by three glyphs, namely, (A-1) for the stroke position, (A-2) for the stroke placement, and (A-3) for the stroke technique. (B) shows three types of configurations of the tactic.

Fig. 7. (A) shows the score information of Wang Hao (cyan) and Oh Sang-eun (orange) on April 6, 2007. (B) shows the match view of Kalinikos Kreanga (cyan) and Wang Hao (orange) on May 19, 2008. (C) shows the detailed stroke information of a long rally selected by an expert. (D) shows the serve tactics of Wang Hao (D-1) and Oh Sang-eun (D-2) in the end phases of rallies.
